q: Simon Cowell is now reportedly doing all he can to convince his American business partners that the 27-year-old Girls Aloud star has what it takes to draw audiences in across the Atlantic. The source added to The Sun: Simon Cowell has been the only one pushing for her and trying to convince everyone that she'll be a big hit. "They want to see if the American public warm to her before she takes on such a high-profile role in one of the biggest shows on US TV. for the invasion of Iraq in a famous session of the UN Security Council and then, in Donald Rumsfeld 's words, claiming that he was "somehow innocently misled into making a false declaration." Rumseld writes: Colin Powell was not duped or misled by anybody, nor did he lie about Saddam Hussein 's suspected WMD stockpiles. The president did not lie. The vice president did not lie. Condoleezza Rice did not lie. I did not lie. The Congress did not lie. The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong. Donald Rumsfeld , in his book, is particularly galled that Colin Powell issued an apology for the looting of Baghdad's Iraqi National Museum and vowed to recover stolen artifacts. Eric Schmidt said that although what he called the "triumvirate approach" of leadership by himself, Page and Sergey Brin has real benefits, it is time to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability. Eric Schmidt became CEO of Google Inc. in July 2001, when he'd already been chairman of the board for several months- Google Inc. put him on the board and made him chairman in March of that year.
